channel.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
channel.description:
Hello there! I'm Maxx and I currently hold the world record for the fastest one-sitting completion of Black Mesa without the use of scripts or cheats. Surprisingly, there are tons of unique tricks in Black Mesa compared to Half Life 2. In BM there is Bunny hopping and object boosting, both keep true to the original half-life name!
Well enough talking, here is the run itself: [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0gHjALhFPFw']link[/url]
If you have any questions regarding the run or any of the tricks I do, ask here!
Just some things to keep note of when watching the run, I mess up a couple of tricks here and there and I even crash once, but that doesn't stop me from getting the world record at 1:24:53.12!
EDIT: Also want to add in that I wasnt the one to create the route, most routing and tricks were done by Elgu, Xanderstrike, D4rwin, Colfra, and Tomsk45. The only route I've created was in the Blast Pit tentacle silo area with the barrel boost and mega willclimb which saves about 20 seconds or so since you don't have to wait for the doors to open/close.

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Edit: Oh wow, I somehow missed an entire page.

  1. There is a toggle option to disable headbob, and a slider for head roll in the Black Mesa tab of the options menu in the mod version. I see no reason why it wouldn’t be there in the retail release.
  2. Try the console command r_viewmodel 0 (with sv_cheats set to 1) It’s unlikely that the devs will add a menu option to this, since 99% of players like to play with their guns out and another .8% are using it to take screenshots with cheats on for notarget and noclip anyway.

I actually thought the footstep sounds were one of the best parts of the game. They were all custom made instead of reusing the stock HL2 ones like every other mod does, and the game handled jump sounds properly with a slight one for the liftoff and a heavy one for the landing, unlike the “jumping up is loud” method most games use.
The drop sounds sound fine to me - I just went through them to see if I noticed any “3 legs” in any of them, since you mentioned it, and to me it just sounds like Gordon isn’t landing flat on both feet, which for most of the jumps you make in the game, he probably wouldn’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: TextFAMGUY1
item.description:
fury:

If you played the paid version of Black Mesa you would get your Steam Account banned immediately. Speedrunning Black Mesa is forbidden. Especially bhopping because it breaks the immersion. retardmode off

You’re just being deliberately antagonistic at this point. I told you I would ban you if you brought it up again. I’m not going to this time, but stop bringing it up or I will next time. If you can’t separate our position from “they hate bunny hopping,” I don’t know what more I can say. It’s got nothing to do with immersion. Or forbidding. Or banning Steam accounts. And everything to do with resources and desire.

As for tilt, yes, disable-able in the options. Was in the mod too. Viewmodel is done with r_drawviewmodel 0, as it is in every Source game ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!

item.description:
Does that command work in Source? I know it does in GoldSrc, and in Source the holster command is impulse 200, dunno about that one, though.

Edit: I’ll take the ninja as confirmation.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: Fr0z3n
item.description:
fury:

If you played the paid version of Black Mesa you would get your Steam Account banned immediately. Speedrunning Black Mesa is forbidden. Especially bhopping because it breaks the immersion. retardmode off

Edit: Now when I look at these speedruns… I notice that Black Mesa looks really shaky compared to HL1. This leads me to ask the following questions about the steam version of BM:

  1. Will it be possible to disable bob (viewmodel bob and viewshake while walking/running)?
  2. Will it be possible to disable viewmodels?
    In my opinion there should be as few viewshake as possible. For me it’s just annoying and it doesn’t really add much to the game.
    I’d also suggest to change footstep-sounds… Especially the drop-sound. At the moment it sounds like gordon has 3 legs.
  1. Unsure, but you disable the tilting left/right, thats what you’re talking about.
  2. You can disable view models in just about every source game, so it’s a fair assumption that you can do it with ours (console command, r_drawviewmodel 0)

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
You can already remove the bob and the viewmodel. Go to Options, Black Mesa tab, and fiddle with the options there, then go to the console and type r_drawviewmodel 0 and you should be set.

Read full topic

If you played the paid version of Black Mesa you would get your Steam Account banned immediately. Speedrunning Black Mesa is forbidden. Especially bhopping because it breaks the immersion. retardmode off

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: Maxx
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

What’s the crash you keep getting?

Crashes usually occur between loads in Questionable Ethics or during the load into Apprehension. The error varies, usually its just “hl2.exe has stopped working” but other times it mentions something about being unable to load a lump or something like that, when I get the error message again i’ll screen cap it.

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: sourcegamer101
item.description:
Maxx:

Im streaming right now for anyone interested! here

EDIT:
Just finished streaming, I got a new world record but I made lots of silly mistakes. Only one new strat in this run and you’ll have to watch in order to find out what it is! (hint: office complex)

If you’re really dedicated, you could do a segmented run. (multiple snippets/parts glued together.) That could cut times down, probably about 5 minutes or more, because you can just keep practicing that one segment until you get it perfectly. I find it impressive that you did this all single-segment though. That requires skill.

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: Viewer
item.description:
CornetTheory:

I spent a bunch of time trying to prove that the blast pit exploding barrel skip could be done before we released, and I did it a few times. But in the end we didn’t fix it in time

Thanks for finding it haha.

…Though I did point out the skips in Anomalous Materials like the elevator ladder, which worked in HL1. That’s why it wont work here.

I just hope everyone on the dev team keeps the phrase “you are not your work” in mind when seeing videos like this - it might be an instance of physics engine (or - gasp - even map) abuse, but considering 95% of the game playing population don’t care that much about pulling off “l33t stratz”, it might be seen as spiteful to deliberately try and prevent it (“oh, so you want to grenade jump over across half of my beautiful, beautiful level? BAM - invisible wall, sucka!”)

Read full topic

item.title: Black Mesa World Record Speedrun!
item.dc:creator: Maxx
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

'Grats on the run.

Do you plan on re-doing one in the future with the community made extensions? That is provided your system can handle it.

https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=15065

https://forums.blackmesasource.com/showthread.php?t=15754

I don’t currently have plans but I’ll consider it. My main goal as of now is to cut down the run to 1:24:XX or 1:23:XX. I can save about 30 seconds just by not crashing although I’m not too sure how to fix that.

Read full topic
